intro: Linum strictum f. alternum, commonly known as the alternate flax. This variant of the flax plant is characterized by its distinct alternate leaf arrangement, where leaves are positioned on opposite sides of the stem. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant produces blue or white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its fibrous stems and leaves make it a species of interest for both ornamental and potential industrial uses.
